tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: つくね（捏、捏ね）とは、畜肉や鳥肉（まれに魚肉）などのすり身につなぎを加えて、練り合わせたり擂り合せてだんご状や棒状に成形した食品。
sen.e: Tsukune is a food consisting of ground livestock meat or chicken (fish meat in rare cases) and eggs used as a thickener that are kneaded or ground together and formed into a ball or stick shape.
Tsukune is a food consisting of ground livestock meat or chicken (fish meat in rare cases) and a thickener that are kneaded or ground together and formed into a ball or stick shape.
sen.cmt: eggs used as を削除しました。（ここでは明記していないので）
sen.e: Tsukune is a food consisting of ground livestock meat or chicken (fish meat in rare cases) and a thickener that are kneaded or ground together and formed into a ball or stick shape.
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 細かくすり潰したり叩いた肉に、鶏卵やヤマノイモやパン粉などのつなぎと生姜や塩や醤油などの調味料合を加える。
sen.e: Finely ground or smashed meat is thickened with hen's eggs, yam, bread crumbs, and so on and is seasoned with ginger, salt, soy sauce, and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Finely ground or smashed meat is thickened with chicken eggs, yam, bread crumbs, and so on and is seasoned with ginger, salt, soy sauce, and so on.
Finely ground or smashed meat is thickened with chicken eggs, yam, bread crumbs, and so on and is seasoned with ginger, salt, soy sauce, and so on.

sen.j: そして、擂り合せてだんご状や棒状に成形する。
sen.e: They are then ground and formed into a ball or stick shape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, they are ground and formed into a ball or stick shape.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正し、カンマを挿入しました。（ここでの”摩り合わせる”の意味が今一つしっくり来ませんが、私では判断できませんのでこのままにしました）
sen.e: Then, they are ground and formed into a ball or stick shape.

sen.j: 細かく刻んだネギや大葉やタマネギなどの野菜類や鶏軟骨を加えることもある。
sen.e: Finely chopped chicken gristles or finely chopped vegetables such as green onions, beefsteak plant, and onions may be added.
Finely chopped chicken gristles or finely chopped vegetables such as green onions, beefsteak plant, and onions may be added.
Finely chopped chicken gristles or finely chopped vegetables such as green onions, beefsteak plant, and onions may be added.

sen.j: つくねとは、種を手や器具できちんと団子状に成形したものを調理したものの総称である。
sen.e: Tsukune is a generic term for a cooked food which is properly formed into a ball by hand or by using a tool.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Tsukune is a generic term for a cooked food which is properly formed into a ball by hand or by using a tool.
Tsukune is a generic term for a cooked food which is properly formed into a ball by hand or by using a tool.

sen.j: 「肉類ならつくね」というのは厳密には誤りである。
sen.e: The popular notion that 'all ball-shaped meat is tsukune' is wrong in a strict sense.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The popular notion that 'all ball-shaped meat is tsukune' is wrong in a strict sense.
The popular notion that 'all ball-shaped meat is tsukune' is wrong in a strict sense.

sen.j: 同様に、「魚類ならつみれ」というのも誤りである。
sen.e: Similarly, another popular notion that 'all ball-shaped fish meat is tsumire (minced fish)' is wrong as well.
Similarly, another popular notion that 'all ball-shaped fish meat is tsumire' (minced fish) is wrong as well.
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。
sen.e: Similarly, another popular notion that 'all ball-shaped fish meat is tsumire' (minced fish) is wrong as well.

sen.j: つみれとつくねを合わせて丸（がん）と総称することもある。
sen.e: The term "gan" may be used as a generic name for tsumire and tsukune.
The term "gan" may be used as a generic name for tsumire and tsukune.
The term "gan" may be used as a generic name for tsumire and tsukune.
Cooking method
Cooking method
Cooking method
Stewing (one-pot dish cooked at the table)
Stewing (one-pot dish cooked at the table)
Stewing (one-pot dish cooked at the table)

sen.j: 焼く（焼き鳥、焼きつくね）
sen.e: Grill (grilled chicken and grilled tsukune)
Grill (grilled chicken and grilled tsukune)
Grill (grilled chicken and grilled tsukune)
Deep fry (deep-fried food)
Deep fry (deep-fried food)
Deep fry (deep-fried food)
